results.title: Arrivederci Roma
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Wright, Richard Zatorski, Australian Film Commission and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Marinelli (Robert Forza) is a new immigrant to Australia who experiences difficulties when confronted with the harshness of the Anglo-saxon culture during a swimming lesson. With an inability to speak English, Marinelli is plunged into the deep end of the pool and cultural survival. Directed by Geoffrey Wright known mostly for ‘Romper Stomper’ and ‘Metal Skin’. Filmed at the City Baths, Melbourne.

results.title: Around the World with Dot
results.brief_description: In “Around the World with Dot” there are carefully interwoven elements of history, geography, bushlore, conservation and social studies with the animated action so that children of all ages will be educated while being entertained. Rated: G

results.title: Around the boree log (1925)
results.creator_credit: Phil K Walsh and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Shot in the district around Goulburn, NSW near Wollondilly river, this historical silent film warmly depicts bush life in Australia in the 1870’s of early Catholic settlers as described in the poem of the title. The priest and poet, Father John O’Brien (aka Father Patrick Hartigan), appears in the film reading prose as the story begins. The humorous tale recounts his childhood experiences of childhood and education in the bush. Wonderful images include the ‘old shaky slab hut school’ and the bush salesman where the mother buys the children each a hat, humourously described…”six ugly extinguishers that fitted us too soon - six ugly upturned canisters, each one a thing of gloom”. The film was not without controversy. When the film was first screened, reactions were mixed because of its obvious Catholic bias; some distributors even refusing to screen it, seeing it as Catholic propaganda. Today, as then, the film is still a charming recollection of earlier days. With music only, no intertitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil K Walsh and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia

results.title: Around perception
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, Pierre Heberrt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An early experiment in employing computers to animate film. The result is a dazzling vibration of geometric forms in vivid colour, an effect achieved by varying the speed at which alternate colours change, so producing optical illusions. In between these screen pyrotechnics there appears a simple line form gyrating in a smooth rhythm. Sound effects are created by registering sound shapes directly on the sound track of the film. Award: Buenos Aires.

results.title: Are there any questions?
results.creator_credit: James Parker, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A recruiting film, filmed on location at the RAAF Base, Amberley, Queensland, promoting the role of the RAAF Shows the air force as a worthwhile employer of people in an extremely wide range of occupations, ranging from the unskilled to the highly technical.

results.title: Art attack 2
results.creator_credit: Neil Buchanan, Tim Edmunds, Nick Bigsby, Media Merchants and Television South
results.brief_description: Learn how to be creative with art - techniques which seem complex are explained simply and with great illustration. Be creative in a fun way, using cheap, everyday objects. In this episode topics covered include cartooning - learn how to draw animal caricatures and different cartoon bodies, and splash out with splash art - learn how to brighten up dull clothes.

results.title: Art attack
results.creator_credit: Neil Buchanan, Tim Edmunds, Nick Bigsby, Media Merchants and Television South
results.brief_description: Learn how to be creative with art - techniques which seem complex are explained simply and with great illustration - be creative in a fun way, using cheap, everyday objects. In this episode you can learn how to make a pastry face mask, create your very own ancient treasure map, and design a poster out of your name.

results.title: Arrows against the wind
results.creator_credit: Tracey Groome, A Land Beyond Production and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: Describes the culture and traditional way of life of the indigenous peoples of West Papua (Irian Jaya), and the social, political and environmental upheaval they have endured since the beginning of Indonesian rule in 1963. Outlines their continuing struggle for social justice and self-determination.

results.title: Around the world in search of steam: the life & travels of Colin Garrett
results.brief_description: Colin Garratt is engaged in a lifetime crusade to photograph and record the end of the age of steam around the world. Colin and his assistant Sarah King begin in Spain, in search of a Manchester built Sharp Stewart 0-6-OT; then on to Turkey and the last of the famous Stanier 8F’s, the Isle of Man and China, making noteworthy and entertaining discoveries on the way. Reflecting on the photographs, Colin and Sarah have compiled a body or work that is a testament to the importance of steam driven power across the ages.

results.title: Ark of Gondwana: Victoria's rainforest heritage
results.creator_credit: Brendan Lavelle, Marion Crooke and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Rainforests are among the Earth’s most ancient and diverse natural communities. They are very fragile habitats. In Victoria, rainforests are limited to scattered patches because of previous climatic conditions and the impact of European settlement. The video examines the rainforest theme in three segments: The Living Ark: looks at the ancient link between Australia’s rainforests and those in other parts of the world and gives an introduction to life in a rainforest. Rainforest Odyssey: examines the types of rainforest in Victoria and their distribution. A Fragile Heritage: looks at the importance of Victoria’s rainforests and factors that threaten their survival.
